name: entwined
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
closely connected or unable to be separated: The fates of both countries seem somehow entwined. For at least 300 years before the 1917 Bolshevik Revolution, the church was inextricably entwined with the rule of the czars. See
entwine
More examplesFewer examplesMoney and power are more closely entwined than ever.An article describes the entwined histories of the rival city newspapers.Learning and employee development are entwined in all aspects of the business.
